item.title: 100 GigE in the Long Run
item.description: As internet and private network users demand increasingly higher bandwidth, long-haul fiber optic networks, including those used by regional and national carriers, are being upgraded to accommodate this growth. The current standard is 40 Gbps, but companies like XO Communications and Infinera are pushing boundaries by showcasing 100 Gigabit Ethernet on XO’s long-haul DWDM network. This partnership addresses two key requirements: a high-capacity long-haul network and equipment capable of utilizing that capacity.
